intro: Grammitis reineckei, commonly known as the New Zealand spore moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces spores in small, clustered capsules that are borne on short stalks. Its leaves are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape, with a smooth or slightly serrated margin. Grammitis reineckei plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil stability and moisture retention in its native habitats.
